reviewText: i loved this movie. i like movies that go through a time period. cars, styles, clothes change with the times. i was so happy at the end.she got the no count, cold hearted, cheap rat. good for her. she rose above the hand that was dealt her and was very successful.she was better off without him in the long run. how could a father just up and leave his children like that????????????the kids were better off without him. he was giving one beer and toying with. probably would have ended up molesting her. the other kid he ignored. was he an alcoholic?  he also picked up the little girl and hugged/smooched her with a cigarette in his mouth.what a disgusting pig.

reviewText: It's a difficult movie to watch but what this Mother, played by Donna Mills, does with her life after suffering devastation of her marriage to a sick, sick man and all the losses she and her daughters encounter is most commendable and inspiring.  What a beautiful example for her three daughters.

reviewText: This one is really touchy. You'll like this emotional TV movie. It makes you think and angry how people can change from lovers to enemies. Here you can enjoy Donna Mills (this time with dark hair...) in one of her best  parts - she makes everything so believable and realistic.

reviewText: This movie does a really good job of bringing out the emotions and long-lasting scars on a wife and the children left behind when a husband just decides not to work things out and just up and leaves. Great movie!

reviewText: I'm a huge fan of Donna Mills, and I honestly think this is one of her best performances.  She is so driven in this role, and I'm sure part of the reason its such a powerful performance is because its a true story.  More women should take control like this.  Do yourself a favor and check this movie out... you won't forget it...
